HDG.BC.content: essential [the earlier?] has its own history (Geschichte), not calculable acc. ciphers (Marken) “new” & “old” [not new, but originary]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: essential [the earlier?] has its own history (Geschichte), not calculable acc. ciphers (Marken) “new” & “old” [not new, but originary]

HDG.EC.content: can only think older definition man, mortal, by way of the younger, thinker, so that only common interpretation of zōon logon echon is shallow > we can think logos originally as gathering, human is thus in the gathering toward the originally all-unifying One (auf das urspünglich alles einigende Eine) > in this thought of logos thinking and mortality think the self same (im Grunde das Selbe) > older, like everything inceptual (Anfängliche), harder (schwerer) to think [finitude as thnētos]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: can only think older definition man, mortal, by way of the younger, thinker, so that only common interpretation of zōon logon echon is shallow > we can think logos originally as gathering, human is thus in the gathering toward the originally all-unifying One (auf das urspünglich alles einigende Eine) > in this thought of logos thinking and mortality think the self same (im Grunde das Selbe) > older, like everything inceptual (Anfängliche), harder (schwerer) to think [finitude as thnētos]

HDG.EC.content: in accustomed translation of mortality, it’s the relation to death, not to the immortals, that is named > only man, not animal, knows death, can go towards death > animal cannot die, cannot have death
HDG.EC.linkedContent: in accustomed translation of mortality, it’s the relation to death, not to the immortals, that is named > only man, not animal, knows death, can go towards death > animal cannot die, cannot have death

HDG.EC.content: [bringing 2 definitions of man together, thought & mortality, via attention & waiting] gathering toward the One of logos: something like attentiveness (Achtamsigkeit) prevails (waltet) > and isn’t attentiveness like the constant waiting on the pure coming > naturally this waiting essence remains unspoken [in both definitions]
